Crafting.name: Poisonbloom
Crafting.description: Flower that grows in toxic terrain. Material used for crafting items. Poisonous, but may also provide the cure.

Crafting.name: Nascent Butterfly
Crafting.description: An arcane butterfly with translucent wings. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find.

Crafting.name: Rimed Crystal Bud
Crafting.description: A young plant, frozen into a crystal before it could mature. Material used for crafting items.

Crafting.name: Rimed Rowa
Crafting.description: A berry-like fruit, thought to be the original strain of Rowa. Material used for crafting items. Found in frigid highlands.

Crafting.name: Root Resin
Crafting.description: Resin secreted from the roots of the Great tree. Material used in crafting items. The roots of the Great tree drive far and wide through the earth of the Lands Between. They were once entwined with the roots of the Erdtree, or so they say.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Secreted from the roots of the Greattree. Can also be found near trees on the surface.

Crafting.name: Rowa Fruit
Crafting.description: Berry-like red fruits that grow in shrubs. Material used for crafting items. Easily found everywhere in the Lands Between, it is primarily used in preserved foods.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Easily found everywhere in the Lands Between.

Crafting.name: Ruin Fragment
Crafting.description: Stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky. Can be used for crafting, or simply for throwing at enemies. These shards of stone are believed to have once been part of a temple in the sky. They glow with a faint light from within.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky.

Crafting.name: Sacramental Bud
Crafting.description: An immature bud containing fresh blood. Material used for crafting items.

Crafting.name: Sanctuary Stone
Crafting.description: A rare piece of stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky. Material used for crafting items.

Crafting.name: Slumbering Egg
Crafting.description: Owl eggs that will never hatch. Material used for crafting items.

Crafting.name: Smoldering Butterfly
Crafting.description: An eternally burning butterfly found near wildfires and elsewhere. Material used for crafting items. Serves as the kindling for a number of items.

Crafting.name: String
Crafting.description: Boasting no special qualities, this is merely a goodly length of string.

Crafting.name: Silver Firefly
Crafting.description: Firefly that gives off a silvery light. Material used in crafting items. Found near bodies of cold water untouched by sunlight. The light of fireflies is believed to have an alluring magic. Silver light is considered to invite riches.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Found near cold waters untouched by sunlight.

Crafting.name: Sliver Of Meat
Crafting.description: A slice of thinly carved beast flesh. Material used for crating items. Found by hunting herbivorous beast. The dried meat toughens the constitution.

Crafting.name: Strip Of White Flesh
Crafting.description: Thin strips of flesh taken from a bloodless creature. Material used for crafting items. The dried meat toughens the constitution, boosting resistance. It's known for its long-lasting effect.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Found by hunting creatures devoid of blood.

Crafting.name: Tarnished Golden Sunflower
Crafting.description: A large flower that blooms facing the Erdtree. Material used for crafting items. Found near Minor Erdtrees.

Crafting.name: Toxic Mushroom
Crafting.description: A mushroom covered in toxic mold that grows in rotten lands. Material used for crafting items.

Crafting.name: Trina's Lily
Crafting.description: A pale purple water lily that is on the verge of wilting. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find. A symbol of faith in St. Trina. Dulls the senses, preventing agitation.

Crafting.name: Thin Beast Bones
Crafting.description: Thin, hard beast bones. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting beasts.

Crafting.name: Turtle Neck Meat
Crafting.description: A splendid, lengthy cut of turtle neck meat. Material used for crafting items. Turtle meat is said to boost virility, but none in the Lands Between seem to have much appetite for it these days. In Lands Between, the urge to reproduce has waned long ago.

Crafting.name: Volcanic Stone
Crafting.description: A smoldering rock containing hot gas.

Crafting.name: Yellow Ember
Crafting.description: An ember taken from an eye socket of a corpse. Material used for crafting items.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Found in lands afflicted by frenzy

Crafting.name: Hefty Beast Bone
Crafting.description: Thick, solid beast bones. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting particularly large beasts. Commonly Used to make disposable weapons.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Found by hunting particularly large beasts

Crafting.name: Silver Tear Husk
Crafting.description: A hardened husk shed by a formless life form known as the Silver Tear, found in and around the Eternal City. Material used for crafting items. The Silver Tear makes mockery of life, reborn again and again into imitation. Perhaps, one day, it will be reborn a lord...
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Found in and around the Eternal City.

Crafting.name: Stormhawk Feather
Crafting.description: A feather from a hawk that lived as one with the storms. Material used for crafting items. These feathers, enveloped in swirling winds, are often used for arrow fletching.

Crafting.name: Gold Firefly
Crafting.description: Firefly that gives off a golden light. Material used in crafting items. Found near bodies of water close to Minor Erdtrees. The light of fireflies is believed to have an alluring magic. Golden light is considered to invite runes.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Found near waters close to Minor Erdrees.

Crafting.name: Gold-tinged Excrement
Crafting.description: Someone's excrement. It has a golden tinge. Material used for crafting items. Often hidden in woods and thickets. Gold-tinged excrement is a highly stable substance; it doesn't dry out, nor does it lose its customary warmth or scent. For better or for worse, it remains as it is.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Often hidden in woods and thickets.

Crafting.name: Golden Centipede
Crafting.description: The golden, desiccated remains of a centipede.

Crafting.name: Golden Rowa
Crafting.description: A Rowa fruit tinted with gold. Material used for crafting items.

Crafting.name: Golden Sunflower
Crafting.description: A golden sunflower that grows facing the Erdtree. Material used for crafting items. Found near Minor Erdtrees.

Crafting.name: Grave Violet
Crafting.description: A purple flower than blooms in graveyards. Material used for crafting items.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: At Liurnia of The Lakes' graves.

Crafting.name: Gravel Stone
Crafting.description: A small clump of sharp, pointed stones. Material used for crafting items.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Found in lands once beset by ancient dragons.

Crafting.name: Great Dragonfly Head
Crafting.description: Head of a large dragonfly. Material used for crafting items. Long believed to have the ability to neutralize poisons.

Crafting.name: Herba
Crafting.description: Evergreen leaves that give off a faith light. Material used for crafting items. This very common medicinal plant can be found in thickets and elsewhere.

Crafting.name: Human Bone Shard
Crafting.description: Fragment of bone with dun mottling. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting Those Who Live in Death.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Found by hunting Those Who Live in Death.

Crafting.name: Living Jar Shard
Crafting.description: A fragment of a living jar, hardened after its death. Material used for crafting items.

Crafting.name: Lump Of Flesh
Crafting.description: A lump of beast flesh filled with rich juices. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting carnivorous beast. Meat suitable for a rustic feast.

Crafting.name: Land Octopus Ovary
Crafting.description: Puffy, milky white ovary of a land octopus. Material used for crafting items. Land octopuses eat humans in order to bear young, and theirs is the blood that runs through these ovaries.

Crafting.name: Melted Mushroom
Crafting.description: A mushroom that grows in the false night in and around the Eternal City. Material used for crafting items.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Found in and around the Eternal City

Crafting.name: Miquella's Lily
Crafting.description: A delicate water lily of unalloyed gold that has started to fade and wilt. Material used for crafting items. Exeedingly rare to find.

Crafting.name: Miranda Powder
Crafting.description: Pollen from a man-eating miranda flower. Material used for crafting items.

Crafting.name: Old Fang
Crafting.description: A rarely-seen specimen of beast fang.

Crafting.name: Mushroom
Crafting.description: A fungal growth that thrives in damp thickets and elsewhere. Material used for crafting items. Its thick, spongy flesh makes it a key component in throwing pots.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Thrives in damp thickets and elsewhere.

Crafting.name: Crystal Bud
Crafting.description: A young plant, crystalized before it could mature. Material used for crafting items.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Widely found in Liurnia of the Lakes.

Crafting.name: Dewkissed Herba
Crafting.description: A herb that grows in the false night in and around the Eternal City. Material used for crafting items.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Found in and around the Eternal City.

Crafting.name: Eye Of Yelough
Crafting.description: A shrub fruit bursting with ripened pulp. Material used for crafting items.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Grown in lands afflicted by frenzy.

Crafting.name: Erdleaf Flower
Crafting.description: A dusky-yellow flower that has started to fade and wilt. Material used for crafting items.

Crafting.name: Faded Erdleaf Flower
Crafting.description: An Erdleaf flower that has faded into a plate scarlet, found blooming in rotten lands. Material used for crafting items.

Crafting.name: Fire Blossom
Crafting.description: A half-ashen and smoldering flower that blooms on the mountaintops of the Giants. Material used for crafting items.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Blooms on the mountaintops of the Giants.

Crafting.name: Flight Pinion
Crafting.description: Flight feather of a bird of prey. Material used for crafting items. Commonly used for arrow fletchings.

Crafting.name: Formic Rock
Crafting.description: Rock formed from solidified giant ant venom. Highly acidic. Material used for crafting items.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Found near Ainsel River and other places where giant ants live.

Crafting.name: Four-toed Fowl Foot
Crafting.description: Foot of a four-toed fowl. Material used for crafting items. In the Lands Between, having three digits is seen as a bad omen. As such, the rarer four-toed fowl's is a gift of great luck indeed.

Crafting.name: Fulgurbloom
Crafting.description: Yellow flower that grows in lightning-struck lands. Material used for crafting items. Imbued with traces of lightning's essence.

Crafting.name: Glintstone Firefly
Crafting.description: A firefly whose glowing tail has hardened into glintstone, widely found in Liurnia Lake. Material used for crafting items.

Crafting.name: Crab Eggs
Crafting.description: Eggs of lare crabs which dwell in the shallows. Materials used for crafting items.

Crafting.name: Cracked Pot
Crafting.description: This empty pot somehow mends itself when broken.
Crafting.effect: Container required for crafting cracked pot items

Crafting.name: Altus Bloom
Crafting.description: A golden-tingerd flower from a succulent plant that blooms on the Altus Plateau. Material used for crafting items.

Crafting.name: Arteria Leaf
Crafting.description: Dark red leaves with thick, swollen veins. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find. A faint pulse can be felt in the veins. Stirs the blood, providing an enlivening effect.

Crafting.name: Beast Liver
Crafting.description: The fresh liver of a beast; a luscious fruit of life. Material used for crating items. Found by hunting herbivorous beast. Dried liver boost damage negation.

Crafting.name: Beast Blood
Crafting.description: Fresh beast blood, glinting with gold. Material used for crafting items.

Crafting.name: Bloodrose
Crafting.description: Blood-slick roses that bloom in festering blood. Material used for crafting items.

Crafting.name: Blood-tainted Excrement
Crafting.description: The bloody excrement of a carnivorous beast. Material used for crafting items. Found in the land of the new dynasty. Mixed inside with half-digested flesh are dense colonies of tiny eggs of unknown but assuredly revolting origin.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Found in the land of the new dynasty.

Crafting.name: Budding Cave Moss
Crafting.description: Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves, speckled with tiny, yellow flowers. Material used for crafting items.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Gives off pale light in dark caverns.

Crafting.name: Cave Moss
Crafting.description: Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves. Material used in crafting items. A fundamental ingredient for medicinal boluses.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Gives off pale light in dark caverns.

Crafting.name: Cracked Crystal
Crafting.description: A cracked, impure, degraded, and altogether unremarkable crystal. Material used for crafting items

Crafting.name: Crystal Cave Moss
Crafting.description: Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves, laced with fine crystals. Material used for crafting items.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Gives off pale light in dark caves.

Crafting.name: Budding Horn
Crafting.description: A rarely-seen specimen of a young, budding horn. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting herbivorous beasts.

Crafting.name: Aeonian Butterfly
Crafting.description: A butterfly with withered, scarlet wings found in the swamp of Aeonia. Material used for crafting items.
Crafting.obtainedFrom: Found in the swamp of Aeonia.

Crafting.name: Albinauric Bloodclot
Crafting.description: The thick, coagulated blood of the Ablinaurics. Material used for crafting items.

Crystal%20Tear.name: Ruptured Crystal Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A special crystallization formed within a tear of life over the course of many moons. Causes concoction to explode when taken in mixed physick. A dangerous form of crystal tear which possesses absolutely no medicinal qualities. A lesson said to be learned the hard way for some; faith can be a volatile matter, after all.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Causes concoction to explode in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Greenspill Crystal Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Temporarily boosts stamina in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Cerulean Crystal Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A special crystallization formed over the course of many moons within a tear of life, a blessing of the Erdtree. Can be mixed in a flask of wondrous physick. The resulting concoction restores 20 half of one's max FP.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Restores half of total FP in mixed physick.

Crystal%20Tear.name: Cerulean Hidden Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Eliminates all FP consumption in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Crimson Crystal Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction restores half of one's maximum HP.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Restores half of total HP in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Crimsonburst Crystal Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Steadily restores HP for a time in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Faith-knot Crystal Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts one's faith.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Temporarily boosts faith in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Strength-knot Crystal Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Temporarily boosts strength in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Opaline Bubbletear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Significantly negates damage in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Spiked Cracked Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Enhances charged attacks for a time in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Dexterity-knot Crystal Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Temporarily boosts dexterity in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Lightning-shrouding Cracked Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Temporarily boosts lightning attacks in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Magic-shrouding Cracked Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Temporarily boosts magic attacks in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Winged Crystal Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Temporarily reduces equip load in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Holy-shrouding Cracked Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Temporarily boosts holy attacks in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Twiggy Cracked Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Briefly stop rune loss on death in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Leaden Hardtear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Temporarily boosts poise in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Crimsonspill Crystal Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily raises one's maximum HP.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Temporarily boosts max HP in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Greenburst Crystal Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction gradually restores stamina recovery speed.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Temporarily boosts stamina recovery speed in mixed physick.

Crystal%20Tear.name: Speckled Hardtear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily raises all resistances and heals all status ailments.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Boosts resistance and heals status in mixed physick.

Crystal%20Tear.name: Flame-shrouding Cracked Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts the power of one's fire attacks.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Temporarily boosts the power of one's fire attacks.

Crystal%20Tear.name: Crimson Bubbletear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction automatically heals one's HP in the moment before death. However, this effect only occurs once, and will expire after a certain duration.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Restores HP when near death in mixed physick.

Crystal%20Tear.name: Crimsonwhorl Bubbletear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction converts incoming damage into recovered HP instead. However, physical damage cannot be converted. This effect is only brief and will quickly expire.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Converts damage received into HP in mixed physick.

Crystal%20Tear.name: Thorny Cracked Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction makes consecutive attacks grow stronger the longer they continue. However, the effect lasts only for a short time.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Makes consecutive attacks grow stronger in mixed physick.

Crystal%20Tear.name: Stonebarb Cracked Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Make attacks more likely to break enemy stances in a mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Windy Crystal Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction increases the effectiveness of dodgerolls for a certain duration. However, damage taken is also increased during the concoction's effect.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Enhances dodge rolls for a time in mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Opaline Hardtear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts all forms of damage negation.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Temporarily boosts all damage negations in physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Purifying Crystal Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the age where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wonderous Physick. The resulting conction purifies the curse from Mohg, Lord of Blood's terrifying rite of blood.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Purifies the Lord of Blood's curse in a mixed physick

Crystal%20Tear.name: Intelligence-knot Crystal Tear
Crystal%20Tear.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Crystal%20Tear.effect: Temporarily boosts intelligence in mixed physick.

Key%20Items.name: Fingerslayer Blade
Key%20Items.description: The hidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron; a blade said to have been born of a corpse.
Key%20Items.effect: Hidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron

Key%20Items.name: Amber Starlight
Key%20Items.description: An ephemeral sliver that gives off a pale amber glow. What remains of a passing flash of starlight. If the stars command our fates, then amber-hued stars must command the fates of the gods. Such is the belief that inspired the use of these shards to prepare a most special draught. Cannot be consumed by mere humans.
Key%20Items.effect: Ingredient used in special draught

Key%20Items.name: Amber Draught
Key%20Items.description: Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis containing a gleaming amber draught for use in a scheme. Give it to Ranni and ensure she drinks it. And we'll be in a position to claim the very finest puppet ever crafted.
Key%20Items.effect: Glistening amber draught made for a scheme

Key%20Items.name: Alexander's Innards
Key%20Items.description: A keepsake of the warrior jar Alexander. Found at the core of the dead flesh that once filled the great jar. The jars contain drags inherited from those who came before. Thus are warriors passed from jar to jar, carrying dreams of greatness.
Key%20Items.effect: Keepsake of the warrior jar Alexander

Key%20Items.name: Letter to Bernahl
Key%20Items.description: A written request from Volcano Manor addressed to Bernahl disclosing the names of two Tarnished to be hunted.Vargram the Raging Wolf. Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm. Both men can be found in the Royal Capital of Leyndell. Find the red mark on your map for the exact location.
Key%20Items.effect: Request from Volcano Manor to Bernahl

Key%20Items.name: Carian Inverted Statue
Key%20Items.description: Statuette of a scholar, with ground and sky inverted.
Key%20Items.effect: Key revealing the hidden form of Carian Study Hall

Key%20Items.name: Cursemark Of Death
Key%20Items.description: Cursemark carved into the discarded flesh of Ranni the Witch. Also known as the half-wheel wound of the centipede.
Key%20Items.effect: Cursemark carved into Lunar Princess Ranni's discarded flesh

Key%20Items.name: Rold Medallion
Key%20Items.description: Conjoined split medallion depicting the Flame Peak. Brandishing the medallion activates the Grand Lift of Rold, connecting Leyndell to the Mountaintops of the Giants. The forge of the flame of ruin is said to be found upon their peaks, and it is here Melina wishes to travel in resuming your journey together.
Key%20Items.effect: Operates Grand Lift of Rold

Key%20Items.name: Miniature Ranni
Key%20Items.description: A doll resembling Ranni the Witch.
Key%20Items.effect: Doll resembling Ranni the Witch

Key%20Items.name: Serpent's Amnion
Key%20Items.description: Amnion from the mother's womb which cradled the poor unwanted offspring of a repellant birthing ritual. It will never dry out, remaining damp indefinitely..
Key%20Items.effect: Amnion from a womb that bore unintended offspring.

Key%20Items.name: The Stormhawk King
Key%20Items.description: Ashes of a hawk revered by all others as sovereign back in the days when Stormveil's winds still raged like no other. This ancient monarch is proud however, refusing to answer anyone's summons.
Key%20Items.effect: Ashes of a hawk which heeds no summons.

Key%20Items.name: Dark Moon Ring
Key%20Items.description: Ring depicting a leaden full moon. Symbolic of a cold oath, the ring is supposed to be given by Lunar Princess Ranni to her consort.
Key%20Items.effect: Ring of Lunar Princess Ranni's cold oath

Key%20Items.name: Dectus Medallion (right)
Key%20Items.description: Right half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree.
Key%20Items.effect: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Dectus

Key%20Items.name: Haligtree Secret Medallion (left)
Key%20Items.description: Left half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path. In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.
Key%20Items.effect: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Rold

Key%20Items.name: Haligtree Secret Medallion (right)
Key%20Items.description: Right half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path. In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.
Key%20Items.effect: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Rold

Key%20Items.name: Dectus Medallion (left)
Key%20Items.description: Left half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree.
Key%20Items.effect: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Dectus

Key%20Items.name: Assassin's Prayerbook
Key%20Items.description: Prayerbook of the Roundtable Hold's assassins.
Key%20Items.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

Key%20Items.name: Fire Monks' Prayerbook
Key%20Items.description: Prayerbook of the Fire Monks, who came from the Mountaintops of the Giants far to the north.
Key%20Items.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

Key%20Items.name: Giant's Prayerbook
Key%20Items.description: Prayerbook that contains the secrets of the Fire Giants. Kept hidden by the prelates who monitor the Giant's Flame.
Key%20Items.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

Key%20Items.name: Godskin Prayerbook
Key%20Items.description: Prayerbook bound in supple skin. Incantations of the god-slaying black flame are written within.
Key%20Items.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

Key%20Items.name: Golden Order Principia
Key%20Items.description: Prayerbook of the Golden Order fundamentalists. A dense and complex academic treatise that contains the Order's fundamental principles.
Key%20Items.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

Key%20Items.name: Dragon Cult Prayerbook
Key%20Items.description: Prayerbook of the capital's ancient dragon cult.
Key%20Items.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

Key%20Items.name: Two Fingers Prayerbook
Key%20Items.description: Prayerbook containing incantations of the Two Fingers. An item once entrusted to Tarnished worthy of lordship.
Key%20Items.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

Key%20Items.name: Ancient Dragon Prayerbook
Key%20Items.description: Prayerbook of the capital's ancient dragon cult. A lost tome that never reached the Lands Between.
Key%20Items.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

Key%20Items.name: Conspectus Scroll
Key%20Items.description: A sorcery scroll from the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Details superior sorceries taught to scholars worthy of donning the stone crown and studying a certain conspectus.
Key%20Items.effect: Give to Sorceress Sellen to unlock Glintstone Cometshard and Star Shower

Key%20Items.name: Royal House Scroll
Key%20Items.description: Sorcery scroll of the Carian royal family, the heads of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Key%20Items.effect: Give to a learned sorcerer to acquire new sorceries

Key%20Items.name: Academy Scroll
Key%20Items.description: Scroll of the Academy of Raya Lucaria, the glintstone sorcerers' place of study.
Key%20Items.effect: Give to a learned sorcerer to acquire new sorceries

Key%20Items.name: Map (deeproot Depths)
Key%20Items.description: Map of Deeproot Depths and environs. At the very depths of the Erdtree's majestic roots lies the source of the Ainsel and the Siofra rivers. Here too begins the network of Greattree roots that spread throughout the Lands Between.
Key%20Items.effect: Revels Deeproot Depths and environs on your map

Key%20Items.name: Map (limgrave, West)
Key%20Items.description: Map of the western region of Limgrave. The demesne of Limgrave, far south of the Erdtree, is bordered to the northwest by the cliffs of Stormveil, and under its ever-clouded skies roll the great steppes of the pale lands.
Key%20Items.effect: Map of Limgrave's western region.

Key%20Items.name: Map (limgrave, East)
Key%20Items.description: Map of the eastern region of Limgrave.
Key%20Items.effect: Map of Limgrave's eastern region

Key%20Items.name: Map (weeping Peninsula)
Key%20Items.description: Map of the Weeping Peninsula.
Key%20Items.effect: Map of Weeping peninsula

Key%20Items.name: Map (weeping Peninsula)
Key%20Items.description: Map of the Weeping Peninsula.
Key%20Items.effect: Map of Weeping peninsula

Key%20Items.name: Map (liurnia, East)
Key%20Items.description: Map of Liurnia's eastern region.
Key%20Items.effect: Map of Liurnia's eastern region

Key%20Items.name: Map (liurnia, North)
Key%20Items.description: Map of Liurnia's northern region.
Key%20Items.effect: Map of Liurnia's northern region

Key%20Items.name: Map (dragonbarrow)
Key%20Items.description: Map of Dragonbarrow and environs.
Key%20Items.effect: Reveals the region of Dragonbarrow on the map.

Key%20Items.name: Map (liurnia, West)
Key%20Items.description: Map of Liurnia's western region.
Key%20Items.effect: Reveals the western portion of Liurnia on your map.

Key%20Items.name: Map (ainsel River)
Key%20Items.description: Map of Ainsel River and environs
Key%20Items.effect: Map of Ainsel River and environs

Key%20Items.name: Map (siofra River)
Key%20Items.description: Map of Siofra River and environs
Key%20Items.effect: Reveals the region of Siofra River on the map.

Key%20Items.name: Map (Mt. Gelmir)
Key%20Items.description: Map of Mt. Gelmir and environs.
Key%20Items.effect: Map of Mt. Gelmir region

Key%20Items.name: Map (altus Plateau)
Key%20Items.description: Map of Altus Plateau and environs. The Altus Plateau, where the Erdtree's base can be found, contains the Royal Capital of Leyndell to the east, and Mt. Gelmir to the west. Scars from the Shattering remain apparent to this day.
Key%20Items.effect: Reveals  Altus Plateau on your map

Key%20Items.name: Map (leyndell, Royal Capital)
Key%20Items.description: Map of the Royal Capital of Leyndell and environs.
Key%20Items.effect: Reveals the region of Leyndell on the map.

Key%20Items.name: Map (caelid)
Key%20Items.description: Map of Caelid and environs.
Key%20Items.effect: Reveals the region of Caelid on the map.

Key%20Items.name: Map (Mountaintops Of The Giants, West)
Key%20Items.description: Map of Western Mountaintops of the Giants. Marching ground during the War against the Giants. They carved winding paths in the cliff walls right up to the summit, leading to the untrodden snow-laden region beyond.
Key%20Items.effect: Map of Western Mountaintops of the Giants.

Key%20Items.name: Map (Mountaintops Of The Giants, East)
Key%20Items.description: Map of Eastern Mountaintops of the Giants. The remote, desolate eastern summit is the highest point in all the Lands Between, overlooking even the Flame Peak to the south.
Key%20Items.effect: Map of Eastern Mountaintops of the Giants.

Key%20Items.name: Map (consecrated Snowfield)
Key%20Items.description: Map of Consecrated Snowfield and environs. The route through this land, crossed east to west by a frozen river, leads to Miquella's Haligtree. This is the path taken by those unchosen, though it is a trial all the same.
Key%20Items.effect: Map of Consecrated Snowfield and environs.

Key%20Items.name: Map (lake Of Rot)
Key%20Items.description: Map of Lake of Rot and environs. A great lake of standing water downstream of the Ainsel River. It is said that the divine essence of an outer god is sealed away in this land.
Key%20Items.effect: Map of Lake of Rot and environs.

Key%20Items.name: Larval Tear
Key%20Items.description: Core of a creature of mimicry known as a silver tear.
Key%20Items.effect: Material needed by Rennala to grant rebirth

Key%20Items.name: Seluvis's Potion
Key%20Items.description: Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis containing a cloudy tonic of bluish black.
Key%20Items.effect: Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis

Key%20Items.name: Mirage Riddle
Key%20Items.description: A riddle concerning a rise that vanishes like a mirage.
Key%20Items.effect: Simple map taken from an imp statue.

Key%20Items.name: Tonic of Forgetfulness
Key%20Items.description: Tonic in a small brass vial. Banishes distress and bitter memories. A gift bestowed by Rykard, sworn to blasphemy, to Lady Tanith, who unfortunately had no use for it. My Lord, there could be no greater distress than to forget you.
Key%20Items.effect: Tonic that banishes distress and bitter memories.

Key%20Items.name: Valkyrie's Prosthesis
Key%20Items.description: Golden prosthesis once used by the one-armed valkyrie. A masterwork of craftsmanship, with practice and skill it can be used as proficiently as a real arm. When Maleigh Marais, Lord of the Shaded Castle, embraced this prosthesis, he claimed to feel the presence of his personal goddess.
Key%20Items.effect: Golden prosthesis used by the one-armed Valkyrie

Key%20Items.name: Weathered Dagger
Key%20Items.description: Dagger received from Fia, the Deathbed Companion.
Key%20Items.effect: Dagger received from Fia, Deathbed Companion

Key%20Items.name: Seluvis's Introduction
Key%20Items.description: Scroll bearing a royal coat of arms.
Key%20Items.effect: Letter of introduction addressed to Sellen

Key%20Items.name: Fingerprint Grape
Key%20Items.description: Eyeball of the knight Vyke, inflamed yellow.
Key%20Items.effect: Eyeball of the knight Vyke, inflamed yellow

Key%20Items.name: Lord of Blood's Favor
Key%20Items.description: Pure white oath-cloth given by Varr. The final trial to be anointed a Knight of Mohg, Lord of Blood. Soak the cloth with a maiden's blood... The blood of anyone's maiden will do. You are maidenless, after all.  After: Fully reddened oath-cloth, dyed in a maiden's blood. The final trial is complete. Luminary Mohg is sure to welcome you into his service, as a knigh who will lay the foundations for his dynasty.
Key%20Items.effect: Pure white oath-cloth given by Varr. Bloodied white oath-cloth, dyed in a maiden's blood

Key%20Items.name: Sellen's Primal Glintstone
Key%20Items.description: Glintstone from within the sorceress Sellen's body.Seemingly half-alive, blood vessels are visible within. In essence, a primal glintstone is a sorcerer's soul. If transplanted into a compatible new body after their original body dies, the sorcerer will rise again.My apprentice, do you think it distasteful?
Key%20Items.effect: Glintstone from within Sellen's body.

Key%20Items.name: Dancer's Castanets
Key%20Items.description: Castanets used by dancers from foreign lands. Received from Patches. The passionate dance comprises no seductiveness, but merely a dignified beauty.
Key%20Items.effect: Castanets used by dancers from distant lands

Key%20Items.name: Sellian Sealbreaker
Key%20Items.description: Glintstone key received from the sorceress Sellen. Capable of breaking the seal that keeps Master Lusat confined. Sellia, Town of Sorcerery can be found in Caelid. This key was said to have been found in the possession of a Sellian sorcerer.
Key%20Items.effect: Can release Master Lusat from his confinement.

Key%20Items.name: Iji's Confession
Key%20Items.description: A letter of confession found on Iji's corpse. He declares his own guilt for having sealed away Blaidd.
Key%20Items.effect: Letter of confession found on Iji's corpse..

Key%20Items.name: Seedbed Curse
Key%20Items.description: Curse grown on a corpse killed and defiled by the Dung Eater. A tender pox afflicted with omen horns.
Key%20Items.effect: Curse grown on a body defiled by a Dung Eater

Key%20Items.name: Dragon Heart
Key%20Items.description: Dragon heart seized by a dragon tracker. It has a bizarre shape, mottled by gravel, and it continues to beat vivaciously. An offering used in the Dragon Communion. Consume a dragon's heart at the altar to make its power yours. While a terrible and savage-looking thing, the heart has a peculiar beauty to it.
Key%20Items.effect: Gain power of the dragon at the Dragon Communion altar.

Key%20Items.name: Black Knifeprint
Key%20Items.description: On the Night of the Black Knives, someone stole a fragment of Death from Maliketh, the Black Blade, and imbued its power into the assassins' daggers.
Key%20Items.effect: Mark of the Night of the Black Knives ritual

Key%20Items.name: Irina's Letter
Key%20Items.description: Letter given by Irina, addressed to her father, the commander of Castle Morne. Gorgeous silken handkerchief, lightly stained with blood. Words can be made out within
Key%20Items.effect: Letter addressed to the commander of Castle Morne

Key%20Items.name: Chrysalids' Memento
Key%20Items.description: Memento left by the chrysalids sacrificed for grafting. A brooch wrapped in red velvet. Traces of blood are visible.
Key%20Items.effect: Broach wrapped in red velvet

Key%20Items.name: Beast Eye
Key%20Items.description: Claw-marked stone eye received from Gurranq, Beast Clergyman.
Key%20Items.effect: Said to tremble when close to Deathroot

Key%20Items.name: Deathroot
Key%20Items.description: A source that gives rise to Those Who Live in Death.
Key%20Items.effect: Beast Clergyman seeks and devours these

Key%20Items.name: Shabriri Grape
Key%20Items.description: A yellowing, oozing eyeball of the infirm. The surface is shriveled, and the inside is squishy, not unlike a large, overly-ripe grape.
Key%20Items.effect: Yellow, oozing eyeball of the infirm

Key%20Items.name: Irina's Letter
Key%20Items.description: Letter given by Irina, addressed to her father, the commander of Castle Morne. Gorgeous silken handkerchief, lightly stained with blood. Words can be made out within
Key%20Items.effect: Letter addressed to the commander of Castle Morne

Key%20Items.name: Volcano Manor Invitation
Key%20Items.description: Letter given by Rya as thanks for retrieving her necklace. Contains an invitation to Volcano Manor. Brave Tarnished, Seek the Altus Plateau in the realm of the Erdtree. Prove yourself by making this journey, and the Volcano Manor will fully extend its invitation. To fight, amongst a family of champions.
Key%20Items.effect: Letter of invitation to Volcano Manor.

Key%20Items.name: Rya's Necklace
Key%20Items.description: Necklace stolen from Rya by the blackguard. Features a relief of a dignified looking woman from a foreign country. It appears to hold great significance for Rya.
Key%20Items.effect: Rya's necklace, stolen by a blackguard.

Key%20Items.name: Discarded Palace Key
Key%20Items.description: A key discarded by Lunar Princess Ranni alongside her very flesh. Opens a treasure chest passed down to Carian Princesses. It is said to be found in the Grand Library of Raya Lucaria with her mother Rennala.
Key%20Items.effect: Key to treasure chest for Carian Princesses

Key%20Items.name: Imbued Sword Key
Key%20Items.description: Stone key shaped like a sword. A special item, imbued with rich blue magic.
Key%20Items.effect: Unseals sending gate, but disappears upon use

Key%20Items.name: Drawing-room Key
Key%20Items.description: Key to Volcano Manor's drawing room.
Key%20Items.effect: Key to the Volcano Manor drawing room

Key%20Items.name: Hosts' Trick-mirror
Key%20Items.description: A small, clouded mirror that reflects a flesh-and-blood figure.
Key%20Items.effect: Take on appearance of a cooperator

Key%20Items.name: Stonesword Key
Key%20Items.description: A sword-shaped stone key.
Key%20Items.effect: Use to break one imp statue seal

Key%20Items.name: Academy Glintstone Key
Key%20Items.description: Key to the seals binding both gates to the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Key%20Items.effect: Key to open the academy's two sealed gates

Key%20Items.name: Sewer-gaol Key
Key%20Items.description: Filthy key received from the Dung Eater.
Key%20Items.effect: Unlocks sewer-gaol door beneath Leyndell

Key%20Items.name: Rusty Key
Key%20Items.description: Rusted iron key.
Key%20Items.effect: Opens a locked door in Stormveil Castle

Key%20Items.name: Unalloyed Gold Needle
Key%20Items.description: An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold, snapped in half.
Key%20Items.effect: Snapped intricate needle of unalloyed gold

Key%20Items.name: Memory Stone
Key%20Items.description: A black, lightly beguiling stone.
Key%20Items.effect: Increases memory slots

Key%20Items.name: Talisman Pouch
Key%20Items.description: Small, withered bag, knitted by hand. Bestowed upon the ruling lord, or those atempting to become lord, by the elderly Finger Reader.
Key%20Items.effect: Increases Talisman equip slots.

Key%20Items.name: Sewing Needle
Key%20Items.description: A large sewing needle, curved like a fang. Boc the demi-human's prized possession.
Key%20Items.effect: Boc the demi-human's prized sewing needle

Key%20Items.name: Tailoring Tools
Key%20Items.description: A portable set of tailoring tools.
Key%20Items.effect: Enables armor adjustment at sites of grace

Key%20Items.name: Golden Tailoring Tools
Key%20Items.description: Tailoring tools made from gold.
Key%20Items.effect: Allows demigod garb alteration at sites of grace

Key%20Items.name: Gold Sewing Needle
Key%20Items.description: Sewing needle made of gold.
Key%20Items.effect: Special sewing needle for demigod attire

Key%20Items.name: Spectral Steed Whistle
Key%20Items.description: A delicate goldwork ring. Can be used as a finger whistle. Sound the whistle to summon and ride spectral steed. (Dismounts steed when used while on horseback.) Upon death, the spectral steed can be summoned again, but doing so consumes the Flask of Crimson Tears.
Key%20Items.effect: Summon and ride spectral steed Torrent.

Key%20Items.name: Spirit Calling Bell
Key%20Items.description: A bell capable of summoning various spirits from ashen remains. It usually requires FP to use.
Key%20Items.effect: Bell that summons various spirits from ashen items

Key%20Items.name: Tailoring Tools
Key%20Items.description: A portable set of tailoring tools.
Key%20Items.effect: Enables armor adjustment at sites of grace

Key%20Items.name: Crafting Kit
Key%20Items.description: Leather bag containing a pestle and mortar, small blade, and various other tools. Enables item crafting from the main menu. Provides both means to fight and means to survive.
Key%20Items.effect: Enables the practice of item Crafting

Key%20Items.name: Ritual Pot
Key%20Items.description: This empty pot somehow mends itself when broken. Special item with greater durability than a cracked pot.
Key%20Items.effect: Container required for crafting ritual pot items

Key%20Items.name: Perfume Bottle
Key%20Items.description: Glass bottles used by perfumers. Used to seal various scent compounds.
Key%20Items.effect: Container required for crafting perfume items

Tools.name: Telescope
Tools.description: Astrology tool used by members of the Carian royal family. Part of a larger instrument, removed and stolen away. Allows the viewer to better see faraway things. During the age of the Erdtree, Carian astrology withered on the vine. The fate once writ in the night skies had been fettered by the Golden Order.
Tools.effect: Allows viewer to see faraway things

Tools.name: Lantern
Tools.description: A small waist-worn lantern that illuminates surroundings. Use once to turn on, and again to turn off. While its light is dimmer than that of a torch, it has the advantage of freeing up the user's hands.
Tools.effect: Attach to waist to illuminate surroundings

Tools.name: Mimic's Veil
Tools.description: Golden veil of intricate design.
Tools.effect: Uses FP to mimic nearby objects.

Tools.name: Ancestral Infant's Head
Tools.description: Skull of a very young ancestral spirit. Just think how many sproutings It might bear.
Tools.effect: Uses FP to spray spirit vapor

Tools.name: Wraith Calling Bell
Tools.description: Bell used by worshippers of revenants.
Tools.effect: Uses FP to ring bell and calls prowling wraiths

Tools.name: Omen Bairn
Tools.description: Doll of a curseborn bairn.
Tools.effect: Uses FP to unleash wraiths that chase down foes

Tools.name: Mohg's Shackle
Tools.description: A fetish bathed in golden magic.
Tools.effect: Briefly binds Mohg, once imprisoned, to earth

Tools.name: Margit's Shackle
Tools.description: A fetish bathed in golden magic. Shackles were used to bind the accursed people called the Omen, and these ones were made to keep a particular Omen under strictest confinement. Though faint, the shackles still retain vestiges of power  enough to trap the once-bound Margit on earth, if only for a short time.
Tools.effect: Binds Margit and Morgott two times per battle

Tools.name: Memory Of Grace
Tools.description: A phantom vision of the first grace, which once guided the Tarnished to the Lands Between. Lose all runes and return to last site of grace at which you rested. It all repeats. Be seen by the Elden Ring. Become the Elden Lord.
Tools.effect: Lose all runes, return to last site of lost grace.

Tools.name: Regal Omen Bairn
Tools.description: Doll of a curseborn bairn from the Erdtree's royal line.  Uses FP to unleash many wraiths that chase down foes.
Tools.effect: Uses FP to unleash many wraiths that chase that foes

Tools.name: Blasphemous Claw
Tools.description: A slab of rock engraved with traces of the Rune of Death.
Tools.effect: Deflects the power of the Black Blade

Tools.name: Prattling Pate "hello"
Tools.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.
Tools.effect: Emits a voice that says "Hello"

Tools.name: Prattling Pate "thank You"
Tools.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.
Tools.effect: Emits a voice that says "Thank you"

Tools.name: Prattling Pate "apologies"
Tools.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head. Emits a voice that says "Apologies."
Tools.effect: Emits a voice that says "Apologies"

Tools.name: Prattling Pate "wonderful"
Tools.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head. Emits a voice that says "Wonderful."
Tools.effect: Emits a voice that says "Wonderful"

Tools.name: Prattling Pate "You're Beautiful"
Tools.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a demi-human head. Emits a voice that says "You're beautiful."
Tools.effect: Emits a voice that says "You're beautiful"

Tools.name: Prattling Pate "Please Help"
Tools.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head. Emits a voice that says "Please help."
Tools.effect: Emits a voice that says "Please help"

Tools.name: Prattling Pate "Let's Get To It"
Tools.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head. Emits a voice that says "Let's Get To It."
Tools.effect: Emits a voice that says "Let's Get To It"

Tools.name: Prattling Pate "My Beloved"
Tools.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head. Emits a voice that says "My Beloved."
Tools.effect: Emits a voice that says "My Beloved"

Tools.name: Flask Of Crimson Tears
Tools.description: A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.
Tools.effect: Restores HP

Tools.name: Flask Of Cerulean Tears
Tools.description: A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with cerulean tears, this flask restores FP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.
Tools.effect: Restores FP

Tools.name: Flask Of Wondrous Physick
Tools.description: A relic of the physick chemists, priests of the Erdtree. Harnesses the powers of crystal tears, which only form after the passage of many moons. Various specials effects are bestowed upon the drinker, dependent on the specific mixture of crystal tears. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that in the Lands Between, pools of crystal tears amass at the bases of Minor Erdtrees.
Tools.effect: Bestows various special effects

Consumable.name: Pauper's Rune
Consumable.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of The Lands Between; the lingering residue of gold. Use to gain a few runes. For all that they may be feeble things, these runes will act as nourishment for the development of any Tarnished. Provided a Finger Maiden can be found...
Consumable.effect: Use to gain a few runes

Consumable.name: Lands Between Rune
Consumable.description: Grace said to have once dwelled in the eyes of the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering residue of gold.
Consumable.effect: Use to gain many runes

Consumable.name: Golden Rune [1]
Consumable.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between;
Consumable.effect: Use to gain a small number of runes

Consumable.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between;
Consumable.effect: Use to gain a small number of runes (400)

Consumable.effect: Use to gain a great many runes

Consumable.name: Numen's rune
Consumable.description: Grace the dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering residue of gold. Use to gain a multitude of runes. The Numen are said to have come from outside the Lands Between, and are in fact of the same stock as Queen Marika herself.
Consumable.effect: Use to gain a multitude of runes

Consumable.name: Hero's Rune [1]
Consumable.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between;
Consumable.effect: Use to gain an abundance of runes.

Consumable.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between;

Consumable.effect: Use to gain an abundance of runes.

Consumable.name: Lord's Rune
Consumable.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between;
Consumable.effect: Use to gain an enormous abundance of runes

Consumable.name: Lightningproof Dried Liver
Consumable.description: Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in an yellow medicinal
Consumable.effect: Temporarily boosts lightning damage negation

Consumable.name: Holyproof Dried Liver
Consumable.description: Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in a golden medicinal solution. Craftable item.
Consumable.effect: Temporarily boosts holy damage negation

Consumable.name: Holyproof Dried Liver
Consumable.description: Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in a golden medicinal solution. Craftable item.
Consumable.effect: Temporarily boosts holy damage negation

Consumable.name: Spellproof Dried Liver
Consumable.description: Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in a blue medicinal
Consumable.effect: Temporarily boosts magic damage negation

Consumable.name: Fireproof Dried Liver
Consumable.description: Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in a flame-hued medical solution. Craftable item. Boosts fire damage negation for a short time, improving damage mitigation against attacks imbued with fire.
Consumable.effect: Boosts  Fire Damage Negation for a short time.

Consumable.name: Thawfrost Boluses
Consumable.description: Ice-hued boluses made from cave moss. Craftable item.
Consumable.effect: Alleviates buildup of frost

Consumable.name: Clarifying Boluses
Consumable.description: Yellow boluses made of cave moss. Craftable item. Alleviates madness buildup. Madness accumulates slowly, inflicting heavy damage and reducing FP once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such events.
Consumable.effect: Alleviates madness buildup

Consumable.name: Rejuvenating Boluses
Consumable.description: Black boluses made of cave moss. Craftable item.
Consumable.effect: Alleviates death blight buildup

Consumable.name: Preserving Boluses
Consumable.description: Scarlet boluses made of cave moss. Craftable item.
Consumable.effect: Alleviates scarlet rot buildup and cures rot

Consumable.name: Stimulating Boluses
Consumable.description: Light-purple boluses made from cave moss. Craftable item. Alleviates buildup of sleep. Sleep accumulates gradually, causing sudden fogginess and loss of FP once the threshold is reached, even if it does not force the afflicted into true slumber. Take one of these into timely fashion to avoid such events.
Consumable.effect: Alleviates buildup of sleep

Consumable.name: Stanching Boluses
Consumable.description: Red boluses made from cave moss Craftable item. Alleviates impending blood loss Blood loss escalates gradually, causing great damage once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.
Consumable.effect: Alleviates impending blood loss

Consumable.name: Neutralizing Boluses
Consumable.description: Green boluses made from cave moss. Craftable item. Alleviates poison buildup and cures poison ailment. Poison accumulates gradually, coming into effect once the threshold is reached. Poison ailment lowers HP in steady increments for a period.
Consumable.effect: Alleviates poison buildup and cures poison

Consumable.name: Dappled Cured Meat
Consumable.description: Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a dappled medicinal solution. Craftable item.
Consumable.effect: Temporarily boosts Immunity, Robustness, and Focus

Consumable.name: Dappled White Cured Meat
Consumable.description: A white sliced meat, dried out after pickling in a dappled medicinal solution. Craftable item.
Consumable.effect: Temporarily boosts immunity, robustness, and focus

Consumable.name: Clarifying Cured Meat
Consumable.description: Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a purple medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts focus. Higher focus helps to mitigate the buildup of sleep and madness.
Consumable.effect: Temporarily boosts focus

Consumable.name: Clarifying White Cured Meat
Consumable.description: A white sliced meat, dried out after pickling in a purple medicinal solution. Craftable item.
Consumable.effect: Temporarily boosts focus

Consumable.name: Immunizing Cured Meat
Consumable.description: Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a green medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts immunity Higher immunity helps to mitigate the buildup of various poisons and scarlet rot
Consumable.effect: Temporarily boosts Immunity

Consumable.name: Immunizing White Cured Meat
Consumable.description: A white sliced meat, dried out after pickling in a green medicinal solution.
Consumable.effect: Temporarily boosts immunity

Consumable.name: Invigorating Cured Meat
Consumable.description: Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a red medicinal solution. Craftable item.
Consumable.effect: Temporarily boosts Robustness

Consumable.name: Invigorating White Cured Meat
Consumable.description: A white sliced meat, dried out after pickling in a red medicinal solution. Craftable item.
Consumable.effect: Temporarily boosts Robustness

Consumable.name: Celestial Dew
Consumable.description: A hidden Tear found in the Eternal City. Also known as a Night Tear.
Consumable.effect: Carry out Absolution at the Church of Vows

Consumable.name: Baldachin's Blessing
Consumable.description: Favor bestowed by a deathbed companion. Protection of a hidden
Consumable.effect: Uses FP to temporarilty boost poise

Consumable.name: Radiant Baldachin's Blessing
Consumable.description: Protection of a hidden temple in the guise of a bedchamber. This blessing is of the utmost rarity. Uses FP to temporarily raise poise. The effect lasts longer than a mere favor. It's said a deathbed companion will only produce a blessing of this kind for a champion but once in her entire life. The sole blessing which she imbues of her own volition.
Consumable.effect: Uses FP to temporarily raise poise

Consumable.name: Frenzyflame Stone
Consumable.description: Ruin fragment blessed with an incantation of the Three Fingers. Craftable item.
Consumable.effect: Uses FP to continuously heal chaos followers

Consumable.name: Warming Stone
Consumable.description: Ruin Fragment blessed with an incantation of the Two Fingers. Craftable item. Uses FP to generate warmth, continuously restoring the HP of those nearby. It's said that the Erdtree was once as warm as the gentle sun, and would gradually heal all who bathed in its rays.
Consumable.effect: Uses FP to continuously heal nearby allies

Consumable.name: Glowstone
Consumable.description: Polished Ruin Fragment that shines brighter than a Rainbow Stone. Craftable item. Emits light from the location it is placed, illuminating surroundings. However, the effect is short-lived, and it lacks the diverse colors of rainbow stones. May serve some benefit in dark places, or at night.
Consumable.effect: Emits a faint light from the location it is placed

Consumable.name: Rainbow Stone
Consumable.description: Ruin Fragment that has undergone some simple processing.
Consumable.effect: Shines with colored light when placed, serving as a guide

Consumable.name: Soap
Consumable.description: A plant-based soap made from mushroom juice. Craftable item.
Consumable.effect: Removes filth and accumulations on the body

Consumable.name: Soft Cotton
Consumable.description: A soft but sturdy cotton formed from splitting open Rowa fruit in a particular manner. Craftable item.
Consumable.effect: Temporarily reduces fall damage and sound

Consumable.name: Raw Meat Dumpling
Consumable.description: A pungent raw meatball, made succulent by virtue of being on the verge of turning.
Consumable.effect: Restores HP but causes poison buildup

Consumable.name: Silver-pickled Fowl Foot
Consumable.description: Four-toed foot of a fowl, pickled in a silvery medicinal solution.
Consumable.effect: Temporarily boosts item discovery (+50)

Consumable.name: Gold-pickled Fowl Foot
Consumable.description: Four-toed foot of a fowl, pickled in a golden medicinal solution. Craftable item. Boosts the amount of runes obtained from defeating enemies for a certain duration Since old times, the needy would scrape the meat clean even from a fowl's claw.
Consumable.effect: Boosts rune acquisition for a time (30%)

Consumable.name: Rune Arc
Consumable.description: A shard of the shattered Elden Ring.
Consumable.effect: Grants the blessing of an equipped rune upon use

Consumable.name: Rowa Raisin
Consumable.description: Preparation of dried Rowa fruit.
Consumable.effect: On horseback, feed to spectral steed to restore HP

Consumable.name: Frozen Raisin
Consumable.description: Preparation of dried Rimed Rowa.
Consumable.effect: On horseback, feed to Torrent to vastly restore HP

Consumable.name: Glass Shard
Consumable.description: Glass shard covered in dirt.
Consumable.effect: Shard of filthy glass. Worthless rubbish

Consumable.name: Starlight Shards
Consumable.description: An ephemeral sliver that gives off a pale blue glow.
Consumable.effect: Use to gradually recover FP

Consumable.name: Bewitching Branch
Consumable.description: Tree branch blessed with an incantation of unalloyed gold. Craftable item.
Consumable.effect: Uses FP to charm pierced enemy

Consumable.name: Boiled Prawn
Consumable.description: Boiled prawn meat. A prime specimen of plump and moist meat. True connoisseurs know how to keep from over-salting.
Consumable.effect: Boosts physical damage negation for a time

Consumable.name: Exalted Flesh
Consumable.description: A lump of animal pickled in a medicinal solution mixed with fiery spices. Craftable item. Temporarily Boosts physical attack Considered a delicacy in the badlands, this invigorating repast was for the exclusive benefit of those who they called heroes.
Consumable.effect: Temporarily boosts physical attack

Consumable.name: Pickled Turtle Neck
Consumable.description: Turtle neck meat, pickled in a bitter medicinal solution.
Consumable.effect: Temporarily boosts Stamina recovery

Consumable.name: Lost Ashes Of War
Consumable.description: Empty ashes of war, devoid of any memories of battle.

Remembrance.name: Remembrance Of The Omen King
Remembrance.description: Remembrance of Morgott, the Omen King, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Though born one of the graceless Omen, Morgott took it upon himself to become the Erdtree's protector. He loved not in return, for he was never loved, but nevertheless, love it he did.
Remembrance.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

Remembrance.name: Remembrance Of The Black Blade
Remembrance.description: Remembrance of Maliketh, the Black Blade, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Maliketh was a shadowbound beast given to his Empyrean. Marika's sole need of her shadow was a vessel to lock away Destined Death. Even then, she betrayed him.
Remembrance.effect: Take the power of its namesake Via Finger Reader

Remembrance.description: Remembrance of Dragonlord Placidusax, hewn into the Erdtree.
Remembrance.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

Remembrance.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

Remembrance.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

Remembrance.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

Remembrance.description: Remembrance of Fire Giant, hewn into the Erdtree.
Remembrance.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

Remembrance.name: Remembrance Of The Naturalborn
Remembrance.description: Remembrance of Astel, Naturalborn of the Void, hewn into the Erdtree.  The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.
Remembrance.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

Remembrance.name: Remembrance Of The Regal Ancestor

Remembrance.description: Remembrance of Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, hewn into the Erdtree.
Remembrance.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

Info.name: Note (land Squirts)
Info.description: A note sold by a nomadic merchant. Contains information about land squirts.

Info.name: Note: Demi-human Mobs
Info.description: A note sold by a nomadic merchant. Contains information about demi-humans.

Info.description: A note sold by a nomadic merchant.

Multiplayer.name: Furlcalling Finger Remedy
Multiplayer.description: Item for online play. Craftable item. Reveals cooperative and competitive multiplayer signs. Co-op summoning signs will be shown in gold, while hostile summoning signs will be shown in red. Multiplayer begins when you summon a player from another world through their sign.
Multiplayer.effect: Reveals co-op and hostile summoning signs

Multiplayer.name: Grace Mimic
Multiplayer.description: A fetish indicating the guidance of grace.
Multiplayer.effect: Light shows the path, but without order

Multiplayer.name: Scriptstone
Multiplayer.description: Ruin fragment inscribed with letters.  Craftable item. Reveals additional messages from other worlds. Words are gregarious things, drawn to one another much as people are.
Multiplayer.effect: Reveals more messages from other worlds

Multiplayer.name: Blue Cipher Ring
Multiplayer.description: Puts the wearer in ready state to answer should someone in another world call for rescue. You will be summoned to their world as a hunter. During hunter multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the invader of the summoned world.
Multiplayer.effect: Answers requests for summoning from hunters.

Multiplayer.name: White Cipher Ring
Multiplayer.description: Allows you to automatically request for a hunter from another world to come to your rescue when your world is invaded. (Summoning is not always possible) One of the lost mystic codes said to have been bestowed by the Two Fingers.
Multiplayer.effect: When invaded, request the aid of a hunter.

Multiplayer.name: Finger Severer
Multiplayer.description: Use as a Host of Fingers to select a summoned player and send them back to their world. Use when you have been summoned to another player's world to return to your own world. This phantom blade severs the link formed by a Furled Finger, but the maidens scorn those who abuse its use.

Multiplayer.name: Tarnished's Furled Finger
Multiplayer.description: Creates a summon sign for cooperative multiplayer. Arrive as a cooperator (Furled Finger) with the objective of defeating the area boss of the world to which you were summoned. A finger of corpse wax, furled like a hook. It is a relic of those who came before, left to help those who would come after.

Multiplayer.name: Duelist's Furled Finger
Multiplayer.description: Creates a summon sign for competitive multiplayer. Arrive as an adversary (Duelist) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of the world to which you were summoned. A finger of corpse wax, furled like a hook. The bronze adornments are the mark of a duelist..

Multiplayer.name: Tarnished Wizened Finger
Multiplayer.description: Use to write messages. Your messages will be conveyed to other worlds, allowing other players to read them. A finger of corpse wax, so emaciated the bone is visible. It is a relic of those who came before, left to help those who would come after.
Multiplayer.effect: Used to write messages to other worlds.

Multiplayer.name: Bloody Finger
Multiplayer.description: Attempts an invasion of another player's world. If successful, you will arrive as an invader (Bloody Finger) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of that world. Glistening blood has been siphoned into the nail of this finger. Its sickly pale skin feels nothing now, but the nail still aches with sweetest pain.
Multiplayer.effect: Attempts invasion of other player's world.

Multiplayer.name: Taunter's Tongue
Multiplayer.description: Lures in invaders. This allows your world to be invaded without any Furled Finger cooperators present, and it also shortens the interval between windows of opportunity for invasion. Additionally, enables the arrival of a second invader to join when a cooperator is present. (With two invaders, the maximum number of cooperators becomes one.)

Multiplayer.name: Small Golden Effigy
Multiplayer.description: Send a cooperative summon sign to several nearby summoning pools (activated pools only). In cooperative multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the area boss of the world to which you were summoned.
Multiplayer.effect: Sends a co-op sign to summoning pools.

Multiplayer.name: Small Red Effigy
Multiplayer.description: Send a competitive summon sign to several nearby summoning pools (activated pools only). In competitive multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers of the world to which you were summoned.
Multiplayer.effect: Sends a hostile sign to summoning pools.

Multiplayer.name: Festering Bloody Finger
Multiplayer.description: Attempts an invasion of another player's world. If successful, you will arrive as an invader (Bloody Finger) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of that world.    This furled finger is blackened with blood congestion. It seems to have been chopped off rather unceremoniously.
Multiplayer.effect: Attempts invasion of other player's world.

Multiplayer.name: Recusant Finger
Multiplayer.description: Attempts an invasion of another player's world. If successful, you will arrive as an invader (Recusant) with the objective of defeating the Host of Fingers of that world. This furled finger is covered in snake scales. An heirloom of the lord of the Volcano Manor, bequeathed to Tarnished who have become family.
Multiplayer.effect: Attempts invasion of other player's world.

Multiplayer.name: Phantom Bloody Finger
Multiplayer.description: Obtained after invading another world. Consumed upon use. Attempts another invasion of the most recently invaded world. This may come in handy should separation from the Host of Fingers force a temporary retreat..
Multiplayer.effect: Attempts repeat invasion of last targeted world.

Ammunitions.name: Firebone Arrow
Ammunitions.description: Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is set alight before firing

Ammunitions.name: Bloodbone Arrow Fletched
Ammunitions.description: Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with a golden tincture. Deals holy damage. Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

Ammunitions.name: Bolt
Ammunitions.description: Ammunition used for crossbows. A widespread, common type of bolt.

Ammunitions.name: Bloodbone Bolt
Ammunitions.description: Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is daubed with a blood tincture. Afflicts targets with blood loss. Craftable item.

Ammunitions.name: Ballista Bolt
Ammunitions.description: Greatbolt as large as a pear for use with Hand Ballista

Ammunitions.name: Black-key Bolt
Ammunitions.description: Bolts used in Crepus' Black-Key Crossbow, an assassin's tool of exquisite craftmanship.

Ammunitions.name: Bloodbone Arrow
Ammunitions.description: Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with a blood tincture. Afflicts targets with blood loss.

Ammunitions.name: Arrow
Ammunitions.description: Arrows used with small and long bows. Unremarkable in any way, shape or form.

Ammunitions.name: Bone Arrow
Ammunitions.description: Arrow whittled from thin animal bones. Though the arrowhead is sharp indeed, it doesn't fly particularly true.

Ammunitions.name: Bone Arrow Fletched
Ammunitions.description: Arrow whittled from thin animal bones. The feather fletchings add distance and accuracy to the standard bone arrow.

Ammunitions.name: Bone Bolt
Ammunitions.description: Bolt carved from a thin animal bone. Craftable item.

Ammunitions.name: Bone Ballista Bolt
Ammunitions.description: Greatbolt as large as a spear carved from stout animal bones. Craftable item.

Ammunitions.name: Burred Bolt
Ammunitions.description: Bolt covered in thorns. One of the most horrific weapons used in the Shattering. Afflicts with blood loss.

Ammunitions.name: Dwelling Arrow
Ammunitions.description: Arrow in which the spirits of small animals are thought to dwell.

Ammunitions.name: Explosive Greatbolt
Ammunitions.description: Greatbolt tipped with a clump of Explosive Stone shards.

Ammunitions.name: Explosive Bolt
Ammunitions.description: Bolt tipped with a shard of Explosive Stone. Explodes on impact, dealing fire damage.

Ammunitions.name: Fire Arrow
Ammunitions.description: Arrow with the tip set alight.Deals fire damage.

Ammunitions.name: Firebone Arrow Fletched
Ammunitions.description: Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is set alight before firing. Deals fire damage to foes.

Ammunitions.name: Firebone Bolt
Ammunitions.description: Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is set alight before firing. Deals fire damage.

Ammunitions.name: Flaming Bolt
Ammunitions.description: Bolt with a fiercely burned tip. Deals powerful fire damage.

Ammunitions.name: Golden Bolt
Ammunitions.description: Bolt blessed with an incantation of the Erdtree. Deals powerful holy damage

Ammunitions.name: Golden Arrow
Ammunitions.description: Carved arrows made in tandem with the Erdtree Bow. Deals holy damage.

Ammunitions.name: Golden Great Arrow
Ammunitions.description: Carved greatarrows made together with the Erdtree Greatbow. Deals holy damage.

Ammunitions.name: Golem's Great Arrow
Ammunitions.description: Greatarrow of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. Used by the Guardian Golem.This hefty arrow is enrobed in tempestuous winds, allowing it to break enemy stances and guards with ease.

Ammunitions.name: Great Arrow
Ammunitions.description: A greatarrow as large as a spear for use with greatbows. Used by archers of monstrous strength employed by a lord's army.

Ammunitions.name: Haligbone Arrow
Ammunitions.description: Arrow whittled From animal bones. The tip is daubed with a golden tincture. Deals holy damage. Craftable item.

Ammunitions.name: Haligbone Arrow Fletched
Ammunitions.description: Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with a golden tincture. Deals holy damage. Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

Ammunitions.name: Lightning Greabolt
Ammunitions.description: Greatbolt tipped with a climp of Gravel Stone shards.

Ammunitions.name: Haligbone Bolt
Ammunitions.description: Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is daubed with a golden tincture. Deals holy damage. Craftable item.

Ammunitions.name: Lightning Greabolt
